playn.core
Interface Keyboard

public interface Keyboard

Input-device interface for keyboard events. Three events are generated by keyboard input:

  • When any key is depressed, Keyboard.Listener.onKeyDown(playn.core.Keyboard.Event) is called indicating the logical key that was depressed.
  • If the depressed key also corresponds to a printable character ('c' for example, but not shift or alt), Keyboard.Listener.onKeyTyped(playn.core.Keyboard.TypedEvent) will be called to inform the app of the typed character. The typed character will account for whether the shift key is depressed and will be appropriately mapped to the uppercase equivalent or the appropriate alternate character (for example, # for 3, in the US keyboard layout). The typed event is delivered immediately after the pressed event.
  • When a key is released, Keyboard.Listener.onKeyUp(playn.core.Keyboard.Event) is called, indicating the logical key that was released.

Method Detail

setListener

void setListener(Keyboard.Listener listener)
Sets the listener that will receive keyboard events. Setting the listener to null will cause keyboard events to stop being fired.

hasHardwareKeyboard

boolean hasHardwareKeyboard()
Returns true if this device has a hardware keyboard, false if not. Devices that lack a hardware keyboard will generally not generate keyboard events. Older android devices that support four hardware buttons are an exception. Use getText(playn.core.Keyboard.TextType, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, playn.core.util.Callback) for text entry on a non-hardware-keyboard having device.

getText

void getText(Keyboard.TextType textType,
             String label,
             String initialValue,
             Callback<String> callback)
Requests a line of text from the user. On platforms that have only a virtual keyboard, this will display a text entry interface, obtain the line of text, and dismiss the text entry interface when finished.

Parameters:
textType - the expected type of text. On mobile devices this hint may be used to display a keyboard customized to the particular type of text.
label - a label to display over the text entry interface, may be null.
initialValue - the initial value to display in the text input field, may be null.
callback - a callback which will be notified when the text entry is complete. If the user cancels the text entry process, null will be supplied. Otherwise the entered text will be supplied.
